thesis.description: Various designs of aplanatic lenses have been studied experimentally and theoretically at a wavelength of 1.25 cms. This was done with the view of determining the ability to which they lend themselves for purposes of scanning a beam of microwave radiations. Several lens systems were studied and interpretations of the measurements were given in terms of the various monochromatic aberrations present. [...]
thesis.creator: Cloutier, Gilles G.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Scanning Characteristics of some Aplanatic Microwave Lenses.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The artificial production of malformations, teratogenesis, was established as a special branch of experimental biology during the nineteenth century. Outstanding among the pioneer workers was Dareste who on the basis of extensive observations on the effects of temperature variations on chick embryos, concluded that teratogeny was always the consequence of a deviation from normal embryonic pathways, and that almost all malformations were caused by arrest of development. He further noted that induced defects in the chick closely resembled those found in mammals, especially in man.
thesis.creator: Clark, Karin Heiberg.
thesis.subject: Genetics.
thesis.title: Factors in the Experimental Production of Congenital Cleft Palate in Mice by Cortisone and Other Agents.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: In this thesis I do not intend to give a comprehensive survey of Bonhoeffer's ethical thought. Many of the terms and ideas which are central to his exposition of Christian ethics, are here only touched upon incidentally. My preoccupation, rather, is with this question: How should a Christian set about making an ethical decision? [...]
thesis.creator: Gualtieri, Antonio Roberto.
thesis.subject: Divinity.
thesis.title: Law, Freedom and Casuistry in the Ethics of Dietrich Bonhoeffer.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: There is abundant evidence in the literature which suggests, that chloramphenicol therapy in typhoid fever influences the antigenic character of S.typhi. Typhoid patients treated early in the disease with chloramphenicol do not produce, in most cases, antibodies to S.typhi. The rate of relapse in these patients is high and the incidence of carriers is not improved by treatment with this antibiotic. However, if typhoid vaccine is given, normal antibodies develop to a high titer.
thesis.creator: Ciplijauskaite, Jurate E.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: the Influence of Chloramphenicol on the Antigenic Character of S. Typhosa.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study was made on the noise generated by a centrifugal ventilating fan and results of the variation of noise with horsepower, speed, air velocity and pressure are given. The results indicate that no one parameter can be used to predict the noise level accurately; and, in agreement with other observers, it is shown that the octave-band distribution is not the same over the complete range of the fan performance curve. [...]
thesis.creator: Chipps, George E.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: Study of the Noise Produced by a Centrifugal Ventilating Fan.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study is made of the elastic scattering of positrons by hydrogen atoms at low energy (E<30 ev.). The Born phase shift of order l = 0 is replaced by a corrected phase shift obtained by means of a variational method, and it is found that the phase shifts of higher order differ negligibly from the Born ones. This leads to a comparison between the Born approximation total cross-section and the corrected total cross-section. [...]
thesis.creator: Chapdelaine, Marc.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Scattering of Positrons by Hydrogen Atoms and Formation of Positronium.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study of the mixing of subsonic jets with cold streams has been made. An apparatus was constructed for the mixing of such jets at angles with streams. Jets with initial temperatures up to 1075 °K were directed at right angle to cold air streams at various velocities and the effects of some of the factors influencing the mixing have been determined and analysed. [...]
thesis.creator: Chakko, Puthenpurackal Chakko.
thesis.subject: Engineering
thesis.title: The Mixing of Hot Subsonic Jets with Cold Air Streams.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: This thesis describes the design, construction and operation of an apparatus for experimentation with small, cylindrical samples under conditions of high temperature and pressure in the presence of fluids. It is also possible to deform the sample while subjected to these "hydrothermal" conditions by developing a differential which can produce either shearing or tensional phenomena. Both open and closed systems can be employed. [...]
thesis.creator: Cameron, R.A.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: an Experimental Study of the Effects of Heat, Pressure and Fluids on Sedimentary Materials.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The present paper is a report on a study of the terrestrial mammals occurring on the islands in the Gulf of St. Lawrence: Newfoundland, Anticosti, the Magdalens, Cape Breton Island and Prince Edward Island. The project was primarily undertaken in an attempt to obtain first-hand, up-to-date information on the mammalian faunas of the islands, which heretofore has been scanty and often inaccurate. [...]
thesis.creator: Cameron, Austin West.
thesis.subject: Zoology.
thesis.title: the Mammals of the Islands in the Gulf of St. Lawrence.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Specimens of Lake Shore Tuff and Porphyry, Nundydroog Amphibolite, Kerr Addison Green Carbonate Breccia, and McIntyre Carbonated Lava have been ruptured under compression, tension, torsion and direct shear. The results were graphically plotted according to Mohr's strength theory, and the constructed angles of failure compared with the experimental measured angles. According to Mohr, the strength of the rock is a function of sliding friction, but the graphical and experimental results indicate rather that sliding friction and interlocking govern rock failure. [...]
thesis.creator: Cairnes, W.P.H.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: a Study of the Rupture of Rocks under Stress with Special Reference to Mine Excavations.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Whenever an evacuated solid is exposed to a gas some of the gas is taken up by the solid. If the gas molecules adhere to the surface of the solid they are generally considered to be adsorbed. If the gas molecules enter the solid the term absorption is generally applied, although the less popular term, occlusion has occasionally been used. [...]
thesis.creator: Bushuk, Walter.
thesis.subject: Physical Chemistry.
thesis.title: Sorption of Gases and Vapours on Flour, Starch and Gluten.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The purpose of this study is to examine the agricultural production in the province of Quebec, and to evaluate in quantitative terms, in so far as the tools of analysis and availability of data permit, the degree of efficiency with which resources are being applied in the agriculture of this province.
thesis.creator: Burnett, Alvin A.
thesis.subject: Agricultural Economics.
thesis.title: Measuring the Efficiency of Agriculture in Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Experiments have been made to determine the stability field of natrolite under elevated pressures and temperatures. The validity of the experiments as reproductions of nature's processes is examined. The equilibrium curve for the upper limit of the natrolite stability field was determined for certain fixed environmental conditions.
thesis.creator: Burley, Brian John.
thesis.subject: Geology.
thesis.title: the Physical Stability of Natrolite.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Every aspect of modern development utilizes large bodies of water for the disposal of wastes. Increasing numbers of rivers, lakes, and streams that were once relatively pure are now being subjected to pollution, as it has become the established (or at least accepted) practice to discharge every kind of waste into water. The underlying principle of such a procedure is based on both dilution, and auto-purification occurring in flowing water. [...]
thesis.creator: Buttler, Ralph.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology and Immunology.
thesis.title: Distribution and Survival of Fecal Bacteria in Sewage Polluted Water.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The variation in the magnetic properties of Manganese Zinc ferrite produced by changes in the manufacturing process was investigated experimentally. The initial permeability and core loss may be controlled over a wide range by the sintering process. Also, the permeability, core loss, temperature coefficient of permeability and Curie point are strongly dependent on the chemical composition of the material. [...]
thesis.creator: Adderson, J. Neil.
thesis.subject: Engineering.
thesis.title: Variables in the Manufacture of Manganese Zinc Ferrite.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The effect of mechanical forces on the structure of bone has intrigued biologists for many years. As early as 1838 Ward recognized the resemblance of the structure of the femur to a crane, and the appropriateness of the form of the femur to withstand the possible forces to which it was subjected. Since it has been universally assumed that bone must withstand mechanical forces, many investigators have analysed and tried to relate the structure of bone to the manner in which these forces are distributed throughout the bone.
thesis.creator: Zemel, Reuben.
thesis.subject: Anatomy.
thesis.title: Studies of the effect of pressure on bone crystals.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: At present there is no general scheme or well defined criteria which may be followed in placing an organism within the genus corynebacterium. Morphological and physiological studies to date, have not provided a satisfactory solution. A rather extensive amount of serological investigations has been reported, but is mainly concerned with the type species, G. diphtheriae. The majority of workers has been occupied with typing studies on the 3 cultural groups of c. diphtheriae.
thesis.creator: Yurack, Joseph. A.
thesis.subject: Bacteriology.
thesis.title: Antigenic characters in corynebacteria.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Candego is a small lead-silver-zinc mine in the northern part of the interior of Gaspé. T he ore bodies are narrow high grade shoots plunging at low angles to the west in east-west striking , steeply dipping longitudinal strike-slip faults. These faults cut a strongly contorted zone in the Lower Ordoviclan sedimentary rocks. The minerals in the ore are quartz, carbonates, pyrite, galena, sphalerite, and smaller amounts of chalcopyrite, pyrrhotite, gold, tetrahedrite, arsenopyrite, bournonite, and anglesite.
thesis.creator: Wolofsky, Leib.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Geology of the Candego Mine, Gaspé North County, Quebec.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The so-called age of antibiotics is generally considered to be of recent origin but the foundation of its beginning goes back to the last century. The phenomenon of antibiosis, the production by one organism of a specific chemical substance or substances which have an injurious effect upon another organism, was noticed by many of the early microbiologists. Although Tyndall, Pasteur, and DeBary worked in different fields of biology, each mentioned this phenomenon of antibiosis in his writings.
thesis.creator: Wallen, Victor. R.
thesis.subject: Plant Pathology.
thesis.title: Antibiosis and some internally seed-borne pathogens.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Cleft palate is a common congenital anomaly, and it is dealt with by a variety of scientific groups. The medical profession is concerned about cleft palate because it is of sufficiently frequent occurrence to distress many people. Knowledge of the mechanisms and materials involved in palate development might be useful in designing preventive measures for prenatal care. The cleft palate condition is of interest to embryologists because it so often turns up in the list of defects caused by various teratogenic agents, and a better understanding of this defect would help in assessing the specific defects of a teratogenic substance.
thesis.creator: Walker, Bruce. E.
thesis.subject: Genetics.
thesis.title: Genetico-embryological studies on normal and cleft palates in mice.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Several years ago the Wood Chemistry Committee of the Technical Section, Canadian Pulp and Paper Association, observed that chlorine dioxide was becoming of importance as a bleaching agent for pulps, and that more detailed knowledge concerning its chemical action on the lignin of wood was desirable. This recommendation led to a thesis by N. Levitin on the oxidation of Black Spruce periodate lignin with aqueous chlorine dioxide under various conditions.
thesis.creator: Thompson, Norman. S.
thesis.subject: Chemistry.
thesis.title: Further oxidations of spruce periodate lignin with chlorine dioxide.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: Twenty-five years ago a geomorphologist, N. M. Fenneman, discussed what he called “the circumference of geography”. On that circumference Fenneman placed climatology, biogeography, commercial geography, political geography, mathematical geography, and physiography (geomorphology); all of which overlapped, in both data and techniques, the territories of related disciplines. If geography consisted of no more than an aggregate of these peripheral subjects, said Fenneman, it would have little right to exist.
thesis.creator: Thompson, Hugh. R.
thesis.subject: Geography.
thesis.title: Pangnirtung Pass, Baffin Island: an exploratory regional geomorphology.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The technique of operation and details of performance of a Dempster-Type mass spectrometer together with results obtained from an analysis of nitrogen gas liberated from a sample of ammonium nitrate are described herein. The results show that the instrument is suitable for the routine analysis of gas samples. In addition, the relative abundances of the two stable isotopes of potassium were determined and found to be in agreement with accepted values.
thesis.creator: Sullivan, Harry. N.
thesis.subject: Physics.
thesis.title: Mass spectrometric analysis of nitrogen.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: The Truro map-area, Colchester and Hants Counties, Nova Scotia, lies between latitudes 45° 15' and 45° 30' north and longitudes 63° 00' and 63° 30’ west. The area, which covers about 400 square miles, lies in the north central part of the province. The city of Truro, with a population slightly in excess of 12,000, is situated in the approximate centre of the map-sheet. Cobequid Bay, an eastward extension of the Bay of Fundy, divides the western half of the mapped area into north and south parts.
thesis.creator: Stevenson, Ira. M.
thesis.subject: Geological Sciences.
thesis.title: Geology of the Truro map-area, Colchester and Hants counties, Nova Scotia.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.

thesis.description: A study of name propagation at elevated temperatures, using the burning velocity as the characteristic of the phenomenon, has been made. Extensive measurements of burning velocity of propane air mixtures over the range of initial temperatures of 0 to 640 °C have been made with burners of several lengths and diameters. Prediction of relative burning velocity values on the basis of the simplified thermal and diffusion theories was made.
thesis.creator: Srinivasan, Malur. R.
thesis.subject: Mechanical Engineering.
thesis.title: Flame propagation at elevated temperatures.
thesis.rights: All items in eScholarship@McGill are protected by copyright with all rights reserved unless otherwise indicated.
